Message:
And so, I played along
with the human charade
and went to school.

Day in and day out,
I sat at my desk,
stared at the chalkboard,
and said what I needed to say.

My big sister and mother
most likely have less time left
than I can imagine.

As each precious day passed,
the feeling that everything
was meaningless kept
welling up inside me,

until it was almost
enough to burst.

As I gazed listlessly at
the rays of light passing by,
shining through
the classroom window...

“Don’t you think we could be
doing so much more right now,
dear sister?!”

My voice was shaking.
My vision grew hazy.

Before I could stop myself,
I’d fled from the classroom.

I didn’t know where I was going,
or what I was even running from.
